intro: Canscora wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. It has a creeping stem that produces numerous small, white or pinkish flowers. Canscora wallichii is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
